denest.network.recorders¶

PopulationRecorder and projectionRecorder objects.

class denest.network.recorders.BaseRecorder(model)¶

Bases: denest.base_object.NestObject

Base class for all recorder classes. Represent nodes (not models).

Parameters

model (str) – Model of the recorder in NEST. This should be a native model in NEST, or a recorder model defined via recorder_models network parameters.

property model¶

Return NEST model of recorder node.

property gid¶

Return gid of node as tuple.

property variables¶

Return recorder’s record_from. “spikes” for spike detectors.

property type¶

Return type of recorder (‘spike_detector’, ‘multimeter’, …)

set_status(nest_params)¶

Call nest.SetStatus on node.

set_label()¶

Set self._label and node’s NEST label from self.__str__.

raw_data_colnames()¶

Return column names of raw data files for pandas loading.

raw_data_filenames()¶

Return filenames of raw data files saved by NEST.

From NEST documentation:

```The name of the output file is
`data_path/data_prefix(label|model_name)-gid-vp.file_extension`

See /label and /file_extension for how to change the name.
/data_prefix is changed in the root node.```

NB: We don’t use the recorder’s filenames key, since it is created only after the first Simulate call.

NB: There is one file per virtual process. The virtual processes are numeroted from 0 and formatted with the same number of digits as that of the number of virtual processes.

get_base_metadata_dict(*args, **kwargs)¶

Return metadata dict common to all recorder types.

save_metadata()¶

Save metadata for recorder.

class denest.network.recorders.PopulationRecorder(model, layer, population_name)¶

Bases: denest.network.recorders.BaseRecorder

Represent a recorder node. Connects to a single population.

Handles creating and connecting the recorder node to the recorder population, and saving the recorder’s output metadata, which contains population and layer information (population shape, unit locations, etc).

PopulationRecorder objects are specified in the population_recorders parameters at network/recorders. Recorder models can be specified separately in the recorder_models parameters at network/recorders.

Parameters

  • model (str) – Model of the recorder in NEST. This should be a native model in NEST, or a recorder model defined via recorder_models network parameters. (eg: ‘multimeter’ or ‘modified_multimeter’)

  • layer (Layer) – Layer object

  • population_name (str) – Name of population to connect to.

Initialize PopulationRecorder object.

POP_RECORDER_TYPES = ['multimeter', 'spike_detector']¶
property gids¶

Return list of GIDs of recorded units.

property locations¶

Return {<gid>: (<row>, <col>, <unit_i>)} for recorded units.

property population_name¶

Return name of population the recorder is connected to.

property layer_name¶

Return name of layer the recorder is connected to.

create(*args, **kwargs)¶

Create the PopulationRecorder node

  1. Create the recorder node in NEST

  2. Update PopulationRecorder’s attributes from the Layer object and

    the node in NEST

  3. Connect the node to the target GIDs.

get_population_recorder_metadata_dict()¶

Create population recorder metadata dict.

save_metadata(output_dir)¶

Save population recorder metadata.

raw_data_colnames()¶

Return list of labels for columns in raw data saved by NEST.

class denest.network.recorders.projectionRecorder(model, projection)¶

Bases: denest.network.recorders.BaseRecorder

Represents a recorder connected to synapses of a projection.

projectionRecorders are connected to synapses of a single population-to-population projection object.

Parameters

  • model (str) – Model of the projection recorder in NEST. This should be a native model in NEST, or a recorder model defined via recorder_models network parameters. (eg: ‘weight_recorder’)

  • projection (projection) – connected to.

projection_RECORDER_TYPES = ['weight_recorder']¶
create(*args, **kwargs)¶

Create the projectionRecorder and update projection object.

  1. Create the recorder node in NEST.

  2. Modify the synapse model of the projection object is modified so

    that it sends spikes to the projectionRecorder object.

  3. Update projectionRecorder’s attributes.

get_projection_recorder_metadata_dict()¶

Create metadata directory for projectionRecorder.

raw_data_colnames()¶

Return column names of raw data files for pandas loading.

save_metadata(output_dir)¶

Save recorder metadata.
